title: Film-Noir | Gunman in the Streets 1950 | A man on the run. Danger around every corner.

sources.title: Film-Noir | Gunman in the Streets 1950 | A man on the run. Danger around every corner.
sources.description:
A fugitive gangster on the run in post-war Paris manipulates his former lover into helping him evade a relentless police manhunt, leading to a tense game of loyalty, betrayal, and survival.

Gunman in the Streets (Alternative title: Gangster at Bay) is a 1950 French-American film noir directed by Frank Tuttle. Unreleased theatrically in the U.S., it aired as Time Running Out on TV in 1963.

Main Actors: 
Dane Clark - Eddy Roback
Simone Signoret - Denise Vernon
Fernand Gravey - Commissioner Dufresne 
Robert Duke - Frank Clinton
Michel Andr√© - Max Salva

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/QucKobmwXmg


00:00 Full movie with subtitles
01:48 Eddy Roback escapes police custody, triggering a tense citywide pursuit.
12:45 Denise Vernon struggles with her loyalty as Eddy forces her to help him.
24:10 Commissioner Dufresne intensifies the manhunt, closing in on Eddy's trail.
36:35 Eddy confronts Max Salva, demanding help to fund his escape plan.
49:20 Denise risks exposure by securing Eddy's next safehouse under pressure.
1:01:50 A dramatic betrayal forces Eddy to reevaluate his escape strategy.
1:13:10 Eddy and Denise face a climactic border confrontation with authorities.
1:22:20 The final showdown seals Eddy's fate, revealing the cost of his choices.
